NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: This requirement is for professional support services for OCIO and the Office of the CDO, including program management support services for the IT Data Modernization Road Map and ICE's Data Modernization Action Council (DMAC). The support services will be used to advance ICE to more Data Driven Organization by focusing on the framework, collect, automate, and sue to solve Technical, Programmatic, and Operational data capability gaps (such as Data Science and Analytics, Data Exchange and Sharing, and Story Telling).The contractor will provide OCIO Executive Support to achieve OCIO and CDO stated vision, goals, and objectives. Sample activities and tasks may include maintenance and development of marketing materials, leadership briefings, and OCIO offsite actions. Support will also include meeting facilitation support and tracking/execution of outputs identified in OCIO offsites.

NAICS: 237990 - Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Description:
USCG STA FIRE ISLAND 
 Contractor shall provide all labor, materials, equipment, supervision, transportation, and disposal required to perform maintenance dredging at the USCG STA Fire Island Boat Basin using mechanical dredging methods. The total dredge area within the Boat Basin is approximately 62,000 SF (1.4 acres). The proposed dredge depth is El. -10 feet (MLLW) which is consistent with previous dredging at the site.  The proposed dewatering and final disposal site for the dredge material is located on the eastern end of the USCG STA Fire Island property.  Work will be completed at USCG STA Fire Island, Fire Island, NY.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The Government requires technical assistance in support of Public Assistance Community Disaster Loans (CDL) Program currently active for several previously engaged disasters declarations. Overarching objectives are: (1) loan application: perform qualification evaluations to provide recommendation on loan eligibility and amount; (2) loan maintenance: yearly assessment of financial situations for active loans and provide recommendation on amount loan recipients are qualified to draw; (3) loan cancellation/validation: perform financial analysis and issue recommendation on whether a loan qualifies for forgiveness of any portion of the disbursed amount and validation of eligible uses of disbursed amounts; (4) appeal: processing and evaluating the loan cancellation appeal and issuing recommendations.

Demolish 2 old modular buildings and install 1 new modular building.  Replace septic system.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: 8a Direct Award

Provide repair and maintenance of the Machinery Plant Control and Monitoring System (MPCMS) and related subsystems onboard the WLB-225 A, WLB-225B, and WLM-175 classes of vessels as described in the Performance Work Statement (PWS). Services to include recurring conduct of appraisals, inspections, reports, repairs, and tests throughout the one-year contract. Required services will include shipboard performance, onsite service(s) during sea trials, as well as in-shop engineering support to include software. Service representative(s) and engineer(s) will be required to provide all parts and perform all labor to complete appraisals,
 inspections, reports, repairs, design modifications, and tests.

The Office of the Chief Security Officer (OCSO) / Office of Emergency Preparedness (OEP) requests a Delivery Order for the continuation of the Personnel Alert and Notification (PANS) system employed for the DHS/HQ environment. The current software is Blackberry AtHOC. This requirement will include licensing, 24/7 tier 3 support, and virtual training.

The scope of this SOO encompasses contractor support to provide advisory services and deliverables to assist the Office of Trade with improving its current Economic Benefits Model.  The overarching objective of this effort is to create a robust, reliable and repeatable valuation platform with technical safeguards, simplified processes, automated data sharing capabilities, and user-friendly data manipulation and visualization features (possibly in Tableau or Microsoft BI). 	Allow for new data to be easily entered manually and, where available, automated through data transfers with authoritative data sources, while also establishing data-input and manipulation safeguards.  Allow for data to be updated and manipulated for multiple consecutive years in the future.  Provide model forecasting capabilities to assist decision-making needs in a clear and quantitative manner.  Provide economic impact data at subcomponent and activities levels within the Office of Trade that may assist in decision-making regarding resource planning priorities.  Incorporate performance and process improvement metrics and measures results and process improvement results within current-year models and forecasting models. Allow for future modeling updates based on changes in international trade activities and Office of Trade operations.  Provides readily accessible data analysis and visualization tools
 
 Acquisition Strategy: 8(a) directed award to Pinnacle Federal Advisory, LLC

The Aviation Logistics Center (ALC) requires contractor support to provide minor facilities maintenance of various types of equipment used in support of aircraft repair, aircraft hangars, industrial buildings and administrative buildings located throughout the USCG-ALC facility in Elizabeth City, North Carolina. This support also includes performing routine tasks associated with facilities maintenance in accordance with industry practices in heating, ventilation, air conditioning (HVAC) and North Carolina building/electrical/plumbing codes.

CBP’s end users require global corporate ownership data and analytical software to easily understand global corporate networks and illicit actors.  From the proliferation of digitized commercial registries and government regulatory disclosures, Sayari has built a model of global commercial and financial relationships and developed a unique dataset integrated in an analyst application that will accelerate and optimize CBP end user investigation and research into trade entities of interest.   Sayari is delivered as a cloud application with global data and analytics, a user-friendly interface, and application programming interface (API) feeds.  Through Sayari Graph, CBP can determine foreign and domestic corporate structure and identify natural persons and other companies located at shared addresses.  These data points validate, enrich, or contextualize the trade and commercial networks that CBP observes investigates.  Combining Sayari data with CBP’s own data enables end users to produce a higher quality work product.
 
 This will be a SBIR PHASE III Direct Award

The purpose of this requisition is to procure maintenance support services for the Dell-brand Servers deployed throughout the TSA IT infrastructure.
 
 The TSA relies heavily on Dell hardware and software in the development, test, and production environments.  TSA currently has Dell servers within the production, development, and test environments. Dell support is required in order to maintain a highly available IT infrastructure.
 End User ProSupport Mission Critical level of service provides:
 
 - Direct access to enterprise-level, tech-to-tech support
 - Remote and on-site support for specialized hardware and applications
 - Online self-dispatch of parts and labor
 - Incident-based third-party software troubleshooting
 - Collaborative support with third-party vendors for data center
 
 The ability to self-identify the incident as severity level one, initiating a swift critical situation response process.
 
 NO SUBSTITUTIONS are allowed. The contractor MUST provide the item(s) requested in the line item description (exact make, model, part number and or description) of the server list.

Revised 9/7/2022 - Small business program has been revised and contract vehicle to NIH NITAAC CIO-CS.
 
 This investment is required to provide continuation of the Confluent Kafka Licenses and Product support needed for ongoing professional architecture and engineering services necessary to provide data transport to the cloud and the continuous architectural upgrades and configurations required. The architectural and configuration enhancements will ensure that our environment is consistently evolving in order to support the growing influx of data transport that will be brought on by Backlog Reduction scanning and application processing. Use of Confluent Kafka will ensure that the USCIS infrastructure can remain scalable and sustain the increase in data traffic from Backlog Reduction scanned files, and from increased Backlog Reduction and Operation Allies Welcome application processing in USCIS systems such as MyUSCIS, ELIS, NASS, Benefits Hub, and EGIS in support of Backlog Reduction and Operation Allies Welcome. Confluent Kafka is integral to our success in accomplishing Backlog Reduction goals and accomplishing day to day application processing.

The United States Coast Guard (USCG) operates a fleet of forty-eight (48) MH60T aircraft. These aircraft return from various air stations to the Aviation Logistics Center (ALC) Medium Range Recovery (MRR) Division in Elizabeth City, NC to complete planned depot maintenance (PDM) every forty-eight (48) months. During this time, the aircraft are completely disassembled, cleaned, repaired, repainted and built back up prior to being returned to the fleet. The USCG requires Aircraft Maintenance Services to perform the End of Line phase, and other duties as required.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), Federal Insurance and Mitigation Administration (FIMA), Risk Management Directorate requires technical support for the Planning and Safety Branch, National Dam Safety Program (NDSP) to align strategy and program requirements to statutory objectives, provide program and project management support for the NDSP’s overall efforts and to provide design support for the Rehabilitation of High Hazard Potential Dams (HHPD) and the NDSP State Assistance non-disaster grant programs.  The office requires assistance providing full operational aspects and organizational infrastructure for the NDSP.
Procure two (2) each standard configuration 35 foot boats and associated spares, reactivation, and training for the Government of Barbados through an FMS BCP case.

The Government requires technical assistance in support of Public Assistance (PA) to assess the efficacy of the CBCSS Policy, identify implementation challenges, and recommend solutions to address those challenges, using DR-4559-LA, Hurricane Laura as a basis for this assessment.
 The overarching objectives are to: (1) provide a full-scale programmatic review of the CBCSS Policy and associated process pertaining to disaster DR-4559 LA on a set of representative projects, (2) identify challenges and make recommendations, and (3) Evaluate a draft revised copy of the CBCSS interim policy to determine whether proposed changes address implementation challenges identified on those representative DR-4559 projects.
 The requirement is to be competed among the three current PATAC IV contract holders.

Provision of all management, supervision, manpower, training, equipment, supplies, licenses, permits, certificates, insurance, pre-employment screenings, reports, file and any other resources necessary to accomplish Protective Security Officer (Guard) services at FPS protected federal facilities.  Typical PSO duties include: access control, visitor processing, screening, control center operation, traffic control, key control, monitor/operate security and safety systems, monitor and report on facility occupants/visitors for compliance with  Federal Management Regulations and the facilities’ posted rules, maintain physical security, law and order; reporting of hazardous conditions, summon assistance in response to injury or illness; report all potential or actual serious incidents to FPS MegaCenters; and provide necessary assistance/response to civil disturbances or emergencies.

The U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) requires a web-based virtual/online postage solution for outbound mail up to 500 pieces processed daily and inclusive of scales, net-stamps, address labels, and end-user training and technical support services and provision of approximately 325 accounts to load, adjust/update, and reports to cover postage fees acquired through the US Postal Service (USPS), Official Mail Accounting System (OMAS) with the 48 CONUS,
 Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Virgin Island and other US Territories.

NAICS: 621112 - Offices of Physicians, Mental Health Specialists
Description:
FEMA/OCAO/ESH requires the Contractor to support managers, employee, federal partner, contractor and visitors alike to design and deliver comprehensive occupational and behavioral program to help build a safe workplace for employees. The contractor shall be required to perform on site services, act as the agency’s Subject Matter Expert (SME) and follow all FEMA regulations and procedures which have been incorporated to prevent exposure and/or the spread of any virus or catastrophic event which may impact the FEMA mission. These procedures may include but are not limited to, temperature screening, COVID testing or validation/verification of vaccination. 
 FEMA requires all services listed in Section 1.0, and detailed in Section 6.1, to be established FEMA-wide upon contract award (list of expected services is included in Appendix B). Locations include fixed sites and disaster sites (including remote areas) locations within the United States and all Territories. Depending on the urgency, some services will require quick turnarounds.  Quick turnarounds are defined as soon as 24 to 48 hours noticehours' notice dependent upon the circumstance and location(s) after the contract/order has been awarded.  At the order level, the vendor will be required to provide price quotes within 24 hours of the request for proposal. 
 
  
 
 The Contractor shall have appropriate databases/automation systems for record maintenance, quality assurance, referrals and other operations for effective implementation of the contract. The Contractor shall have the security, privacy and confidentiality of all electronic protected health information as required by law [Privacy Act and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA)].  The Contractor will need to maintain a database system that is medium or high-level Fed-Ramp compliant and shall meet the Authority to Operate (requirements noted under SAFEGUARDING OF SENSITIVE INFORMATION (MAR 2015) section (e) Authority to Operate) not later than 30 days prior to start of services. 
 For the purposes of providing Medical and Behavioral Health Services to FEMA employees, the Contractor may be required collect Sensitive Personal Identifiable Information (SPII) that may be necessary to ensure safety and accurate medical treatment.  In this instance SPII is limited to Name, Date of Birth, Home Address, Contact Phone Number, Medical History, Medication History, family history and Allergies.  Documents indicating positive identification are also required at the point of service.    At no time will it be acceptable for the Contractor to collect or store Social Security Numbers.

OCCPO is seeking to leverage automation technologies (e.g., AI and RPA) to assist with acquisition business processes and evaluate opportunities for broader use within FEMA program offices.  OCCPO requires contractor support to assess current processes, evaluate opportunities for use, and to assist with the automation development of these processes, using AI and/or RPA technologies.  The Contractor shall provide a phased delivery model that starts with an initial Proof of Concept (POC) and includes a small number of bots.  This POC will be used to determine the viability of AI and RPA for FEMA. The Contractor shall provide support to cover the full range of installation services for attended and unattended bot configurations.  The Contractor shall provide recommendations on process areas that are well suited for artificial intelligence, robotics, facilitate discussions with process owners, document requirements, work with FEMA Program Manager and Contract Officer Representative (COR) to prioritize requirements, and assist with making requirements SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic, and Timely), while maintaining agile practices.  OCCCPO has requirements already established and required for implementation: Contract Closeout Process; Contractor Responsibility Determination; CPARS; ILP Vendor Information Tool; Automation of Contract Log; Tracking of Quality Review Requests (Packages); Automated Tool for PR Package Guidance and Templates; Automation Integration of Procurement Request (packages) at AOD Point of Entry (POE); 5 Year MAPS Automation; CFIUS (Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States) Cases.

BACKGROUND:
 
 Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), the largest investigative arm in the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), is responsible for identifying and shutting down vulnerabilities in the nation’s border, economic, transportation, and infrastructure security. 
 Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) is responsible for the overall management, planning, development, deployment, operation, maintenance, coordination, and evaluation of ICE technology programs and activities. 
 ICE Data Reporting Systems (IDRS) is also known as the ICE Integrated Decision Support (IIDS) which use separate technology platforms to provide major reporting and statistical capabilities for ICE management and mission programs.
 IDRS is conceptually broken down into four (4) major components:
 •	Data Sources – source data received from transactional systems of record
 •	Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) – tool / process to normalize data sources
 •	Centralized Data Repository – staging / storage of current and historical reporting data
 •	Analytical Applications – tools used by end-users for developing reports
 
 SCOPE OF WORK:
 
 The Contractor will need to maintain the IDRS in an operational support state and applying adaptive, perfective, corrective, or preventative maintenance changes. This will also include small scale enhancements to the existing systems, such as adding/modifying reports and adding data sources. There are four tasks within this scope of work:
 •	IDRS Operations & Maintenance
 •	Enforcement and Removal Operations Reporting Repository (ERR aka IIDS)
 •	Office of Human Capital Reporting Repository (HRR) 
 •	Office of Training and Development Reporting Repository (TRR)

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
US Citizenship and Immigration Services is establishing a new agency-wide Workplace Violence Prevention Program, to include domestic violence, sexual assault and stalking affecting the workplace. The program incorporates the use of 5 specially trained multi-disciplinary threat assessment and management units, or Situational Advisory Teams (SATs). SATs are trained to intake and manage violence risk cases internal to an organization of approximately 40,000 personnel. SATs are comprised of approximately 32 assigned individuals (each SAT, 8 personnel) from the following disciplines: security, legal counsel, and employee relations.
 
 In anticipation of receiving specialized cases needing external consultation, USCIS seeks a tailored consultation from an external behavioral threat assessment professional. The purpose of this Task Order (TO) is to provide USCIS with a qualified behavioral threat assessment professional to consult on challenging violence risk cases upon request.

The purpose of this procurement is to provide CBP Officers and Agents the capability to perform effective and efficient Non-Intrusive Inspection (NII) of personnel in order to detect weapons, dangerous objects and contraband items (including metal, plastic, ceramic, gel, liquid, powder, and paper) concealed under the clothing of people while entering and leaving the United States.  Each system shall be compact, versatile by its mobility, and capable of providing an image with the quality identified within the performance requirements in the SOW to aid CBP personnel in identifying anomalies (potential contraband).
 
 Acquisition Strategy:  Full and Open Competition

Description: In order to help inform and coordinate Agency decision-making on the implementation of the Build America, Buy America Act (BABAA) requirements and technical support relating to waiver requests and market availability, FEMA is engaging the services of a national contractor to assist in: evaluating and tracking waiver requests; tracking and responding to BABAA technical informational requests; gathering information to better inform technical decision-making; and providing technical expertise in assessing individual informational and/or waiver requests, possible categorical or national waivers, and other Agency policies pertinent to meeting the BABAA provisions (such as other Federal guidance relating to domestic purchasing preferences for infrastructure financing).

Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Agency (CISA), Cyber Security Division (CSD), Disclosure Branch, requires provide subject matter expert (SME) analytic staff resources in support to further develop a National Vulnerability Intelligence Platform (NVIP) using Artificial Intelligence and Machine learning (AI/ML) to drastically reduce the number of labor hours used in the analysis of software and hardware vulnerabilities and publishing those vulnerabilities to the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposure (CVE) database. The CVE Database a repository and taxonomy of software and hardware vulnerabilities.
 
 This project describes the next generation of NVIP, a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution to obtain rich, actionable, and real-time intelligence about known vulnerabilities.  RIT developed the original proof-of-concept for the NVIP project and performed a 2-year demonstration of its features to DHS’s Office of Science and Technology (S&T), the National Institute of Technology and Standards (NIST), and CISA staff under Contract No. 70RSAT19CB0000020.
 
 Broadening RIT’s prior proof of concept of the NVIP, the goals of this project are to support CISA not only in efficient management and sharing of the vulnerability data but also to enable it to serve as a single source of vulnerability truth for other agencies and partner organizations, industry, and non-profit institutes seeking high-fidelity vulnerability intelligence. The current proof of concept for NVIP provides capabilities such as the automated collection of CVEs and near real-time publishing of vulnerability data and intelligence, surpassing existing publicly available vulnerability databases in timing, completeness, and informed intelligence.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description: The Environmental Planning and Historic Preservation(EHP)Technical Support contract will provide the Grant Programs Directorate(GPD)with the services necessary to effectively manage their environmental compliance program with maximum flexibility during times of high workloads. FEMA GPD is seeking a contractor to assist with EHP compliance reviews for project applications funded through several FEMA GPD programs, including the Homeland Security Grant Program, the Non-Profit Security Grant Program, the Port Security Grant Program, the Transit Security Grants Program, Assistance to Firefighters Grant Program, the Tribal Security Grant Program, and several others. GPD’s EHP Section reviews applications for GPD grant funding to ensure that individual projects meet FEMA’s EHP compliance responsibilities and is responsible for providing grant recipients with guidance and assistance in determining if GPD grant-funded projects require EHP review. The GPD EHP Branch works with FEMA’s ten regional environmental offices to carry out reviews that require consultations with other regulatory agencies. In some cases, GPD’s EHP Section manages consultations with environmental regulatory agencies when GPD EHP and its regional partners do not have sufficient staff capacity to prepare all of the necessary materials to conduct consultations. This contract will provide the necessary program management and technical expertise to prepare environmental consultation materials, including letters, maps, photographs and other required documents and include drafting environmental assessments according to the National Environmental Policy Act(NEPA) standards and Federal historic preservation regulations when needed.

Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) HSINet Modernization 
 HSINet Modernization
 ICE Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) currently hosts a Microsoft SharePoint environment on prem dedicated to the collaboration, document storage, reporting and tracking of HSI initiatives.  This environment (HSINet) is currently challenged with outdated technologies causing ineffiencies, and maintainability/security considerations.
 In partnership with HSI leadership and the HSI development team, the Contractor will bring the HSINet platform into the Microsoft Government Cloud Community (GCC) that currently hosts the ICE-wide M365 environment. HSINet joining the environment will allow for more modern technologies, efficiencies through code reuse and administrative functions as well as the aggregation of data and applications.  Templates will help to standardize Special Agent in Charge (SAC) office and Attache sites.  The Contractor will provide leadership, architecture/design support, migration activities and key lessons learned in analysis, planning and development.

USCIS has a requirement to renewal its Databricks software licenses and operational units to enhance the operations of the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) data warehouse and reporting systems under Office of Information Technology (OIT).  The renewal includes platform database units (DBUs), both Automated and Interactive, and enhanced support.  The USCIS data warehouse and enterprise reporting program is developed and administered by the Data and Business Intelligence Services (DBIS) branch of the Systems Development Division (SDD) of OIT. DBIS has a need to acquire licenses for the DataBricks software suite for production and non-production environments. The DataBricks software is already in use within USCIS and was competitively solicited and acquired in 2017. With this acquisition, USCIS plans to expand the use of the Databricks platform and acquire additional licenses, operational units, and options enhanced support. Specifically:
 •	Eliminate the need for Platform fees and User fees
 •	Increase the number of “Databricks units” (units of time the system cluster is operational in AWS) to 10,500,000 per year.
 •	Extend existing enhanced product support (middle option) for the platform from the manufacturer.
 
 No professional services will be included under this delivery order.  USCIS anticipates awarding this requirement against FIRSTSOURCE II.

The Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of the Chief Information Office (OCIO), Chief Data Office (CDO), Forms Officer, is currently seeking a contractor to provide electronic Forms services. Services shall include form design, creation and revisions through the use of Adobe LiveCycle ES4 and/or Adobe Experience Manage (AEM). The ICE Forms Management Office (FMO) was established to ensure efficiency, uniformity, and consistency in all form management activities in support of the DHS mission. The Forms Manager serves as the custodian of ICE forms; Ensure compliance with applicable federal forms regulations; Prescribes uniform layout and design; and conduct periodic reviews to identify forms that need to be revised or abolished. As a standard, DHS utilizes the Adobe applications suite to facilitate electronic forms programming and design services.

The DHS Requirement encompasses the identification, implementation and maintenance of a web-based EMS data collection and reporting system that will fulfill the published DHS EMS standards for both electronic patient care documentation/reporting as well as provider credentialing/licensing management. The Office of Health Security is considered equivalent to a State EMS Office, and the existing Components with EMS programs should be Regions/Counties within the State. Each of the Components are subdivided differently with the most complex being divided into Commands that are further broken down into Sectors or Field Offices which may be comprised of one or more Stations. Although EMS providers are assigned to a single Component they may routinely move between Commands, Sectors or Field Offices.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Office of Asset and Facilities Management (OAFM), Safety and Occupational Health Division (SOHD) is seeking award of a contract to include Subject Matter Expert (SME) services in the areas of Occupational Health.  The Safety and Occupational Health Division (SOHD) is required to provide a mechanism for all ICE employees to receive occupational health services. To achieve its mission SOHD requires vendor support that will provide and sustain these services to maintain the health of ICE employees throughout the agency.  ICE, like many other federal agencies, faces significant challenges in the current environment of uncertain budgets and mission scope expansion, requiring ICE to maximize its effort to provide comprehensive occupational health services. ICE seeks a partnership with a vendor that can provide nationwide occupational health support services at already established clinics.  These services include, but are not limited to the following: 
 
 1.	Medical oversight by licensed healthcare provider
 2.	Non emergent illness and injury care
 3.	Return-to-work clearances
 4.	Vaccinations, including flu, COVID-19 and travel specific vaccinations
 5.	Stress management
 6.	Lactation program
 7.	Medical surveillance to include agility testing, audiometry, bloodborne pathogen exposure, electrocardiogram (EKG), exposure assessments, PPD skin test, spirometry, vision testing, blood level lead testing.
 8.	Medical clearances for respirators
 9.	Employee assistance and wellness: biometric screenings, health promotion, flu shot clinics
 10.	Physical exams
 
 Potential locations where services shall be performed will include all 50 U.S. states, and locations in Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands, the Mariana Islands to include Guam territories. Non-urgent care requests for Occupational Health Services will originate from the Management and Administration/ Office of Asset and Facilities Management/ Safety and Occupational Health Division. The vendor shall have appropriate databases/automation systems for record maintenance, quality assurance, referrals, and other operations for effective implementation of the contract.  If the vendor provides an electronic solution, they shall- maintain a database system that is medium or high-level Fed-Ramp compliant. The vendor shall have the security, privacy and confidentiality of all electronic protected health information as required by law [Privacy Act and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA)]. The Vendor shall provide occupational health services to include the care for work-related and non-work-related illnesses and injuries, respond to medical emergencies, immunizations, travel medication; and a Medical Surveillance Program, to include nursing assessments utilizing nurse protocols, preventative and routine health screenings, health risk appraisals, health education programs and health clinics.
 
 This requirement will be competed as a 100% SB set-aside (open market); combined synopsis/solicitation will be posted on www.SAM.gov.  Contract Type: Firm Fixed Price (FFP).  POP:  Base + four, 12-month option periods.

The scope of work for this effort is to provide software licenses and support United States address validation upon release of the SEVP Portal. The selected address validation tool must allow SEVP to create all required instances, including development, test and production environments, under a single multiuse license. Support, to include live technical support as well as updates and patches, must be included with the license and be provided by multiple means. Additional requirements for this effort also include, but are not limited to, the following: provide U.S. Postal Service Coding Accuracy Support System (CASS) certified address validation, ability for SEVP to host service, availability of Amazon Web Service (AWS) Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to run its own native server in AWS cloud services without additional supporting software to support a separate virtual machine, ability to automate updates of data used for address validation and existence of a Representational State Transfer (REST) API.  The REST API is a necessary to be provided so that SEVIS and its subsystems can interact with the selected application in a client-server relationship, which helps to ensure that the SEVIS applications can remain more flexible and provide a more stable and responsive user experience.

The Enterprise Data and Analytics Modernization Initiative (EDAMI) Program Management Office (PMO) seeks services to synthesize the results and lessons learned from the initial Prototype Phase Retrospective (PPR) and Pilot Planning (PP) efforts of the FEMADex Pilot Phase, and establish a Pilot version of the FEMADex solution that will replace the current EDW. By the end of the Pilot Design and Agile Delivery (PDAD) contract, the Contractor shall deliver a measured set of deliverables to provide capability to support the minimum viable product (MVP) for FEMADex providing key functional capabilities which align with business prioritized requirements. There shall also be transition period activities to support FEMADex Development Phase Planning (DPP).
 
 The PDAD contract will support maturing and refinement of the EDAMI Program’s Agile ceremonies through Scrum-at-Scale. The Pilot must also clearly demonstrate FEMA cyber-security protocols and be in adherence to all federal cloud regulations, including but not limited to FEDRAMP, NIST, and FISMA. The FEMADex Pilot Phase will continue the following:
 
 1.	FEMADex Pilot Design
 2.	FEMADex Pilot Agile Delivery (FPAD)
 3.	FEMADex Development Phase Planning (DPP)
 
 The Contractor shall provide services to begin build for the FEMADex Pilot on FEMA Enterprise Cloud (FEC). Execution of the FEMADex Pilot Phase include but are not limited to the following:
 
 •	FEMADex Pilot Design, FPAD, and DPP 
 •	Tested usability of FEMADex missions needs 
 •	Tested business architecture workflows 
 •	Automation of Extract, Transform, & Load (ETL) of disparate data sources 
 •	Migration of data from internal network storage to public cloud storage 
 •	Implementation of commercial cloud storage solutions 
 •	Configuration of containers utilizing a FEMADex Cloud Service Provider (CSP)  
 •	Maturation of the SecDevOps and DataOps pipeline  
 •	Cloud Service Level Agreements, Service Policies, and Access controls 
 •	Hardened performance measures aligned to the FEMADex Operational Requirements Document (ORD) 
 •	Agile ramp-up and FEMADex development planning
 
 EDAMI utilizes Agile methodology in its PMO operations and software build which started from Proof of Concept and Prototype, and will continue in the Pilot and Development Phases. The Agile Scrum-at-Scale approach provides benefits to the government by minimizing risks, increasing probability of a success in delivery of the program’s objective, and presenting opportunities for tailoring engineering documents and technical review requirements across the program’s lifecycle. The Contractor shall provide IT and Agile subject matter expertise to EDAMI as they are defining artifacts, data models, services, system specifications and architectures for the DHS Acquisition Lifecycle phases. 
 
 All work in this contract shall align, incorporate, or conform to industry best practices and Federal, and DHS management guidance and processes. Additionally, FEMA policy, doctrine, instructions, guidance, and frameworks shall guide the work performed.

DHS OCIO hypothesizes that establishing a human-centered, service delivery culture will enable DHS products and services to be intentionally designed to focus on outcomes by:  • Creating experiences that are useful, useable, desirable, effective and efficient • Focusing on customer experience and the quality of service encounter as a key measurable value for success along with security and law enforcement • Using a systematic and iterative approach that integrates user-centered, team-based, interdisciplinary approaches and methods, in ever-learning (iterative) cycles. DHS seeks to establish user experience/customer experience (UX/CX) strategy for DHS services that are equity-centered, community-oriented, and designed to meet the needs of public users for service areas such as, Travel, Immigration, Law Enforcement. Define end users and characterize user needs for the three areas of focus. Assess efforts across DHS and components including the following: Usability of existing and proposed products and services in these key areas, highlighting key opportunities for improvement Customer experience (CX) and user experience (UX) design efforts and program maturity.

The U.S. Coast Guard, Surface Forces Logistics Center, Patrol Boat Product Line has a requirement to procure propulsion shaft seal systems and associated components in support of the 87' WPB, 270' WMEC and 400' WAGL class vessels.  All propulsion shaft seal systems and components shall be manufactured in accordance with Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) drawings and technical specifications. Parts lists and quantities will be specified per delivery orders. Each item ordered shall be individually packaged, packed, labeled or marked, bar-coded and shipped to the U.S. Coast Guard, Surface Forces Logistics Center in Baltimore, MD.  Vendors shall be capable of providing world wide shipping as requirements to ship parts to any designated Coast Guard facility or vessel anywhere in the world exist.  As a result of market research and previous purchase history, the Coast Guard anticipates issuing a sole source acquisition contract to A.W. Chesterton, Co., the OEM.

FEMA seeks to improve agency vehicle utilization, efficiency, and management by collecting and utilizing data as a fleet efficiency management tool. FEMA requires higher visibility into the operations of its fleet. FEMA does not currently possess vehicle data communication technology to monitor vehicle operations or maintenance data, making fleet data quality and management challenging.  This data is critical to vehicle maintenance and to DHS’s and FEMA’s fleet-wide decision-making and planning efforts.  By acquiring additional technology that provides the capability of transmitting vehicle data to a centralized data management solution, FEMA will be positioned to realize additional benefits that go beyond fuel cost savings. These benefits include, an improved vehicle acquisition strategy, decreased maintenance costs, improved vehicle utilization, the elimination of time consuming manual activities, and increased data accuracy.

This requirement provides subject matter experts for Vessel Traffic Service (VTS) Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber, and Intelligence (C5I) engineering support. The objective is to acquire services that will offer technical expertise for the VTS and assist with the development, design, testing, integration, delivery, and support of VTS systems. These systems include radar, Automated Identification System (AIS), Voice Communications System (VCS), ancillary power and peripherals, camera systems, and the Ports and Waterways Safety System (PAWSS). Also, these services include lifecycle depo-level and adaptive maintenance to support all VTS systems and network infrastructure. Functions include all activities required to analyze systems for technical insertion, manage equipment obsolescence by devising strategies for new systems deployment and to maintain capabilities by addressing complex system faults requiring engineering escalation.

Description:
A.	Manage and maintain a Property Management System at each TSA warehouse location that incorporates independent procedures, by location, to sufficiently preserve and report all warehoused government property, Hazmat and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) data timely and accurately.
 B.	Property is promptly picked from inventory, staged for pickup, and inventory records updated in required systems.
 C.	Property is promptly received, inventoried, and records updated in required systems.
 D.	Property is promptly staged, sanitized and prepared for disposal.
 E.	Maintain inventory and location accuracy through cycle counting and annual audits.
 F.	Ensure the existing property management system remains flexible, thereby allowing future software upgrades and site expansion capabilities by the end user, or as required by the TSA COR.
 G.	Process property receipts and transfers in the Sunflower asset management system.
 H.	Execute successful property audits through physical inventories and other activities to reconcile discrepancies in data
 I.	Conduct timely and accurate reporting of property asset data to HQ and field representatives
 J.	Provide administrative support to HQ and field levels.

These services shall support the missions and requirements of the C5I Service Center (C5ISC); the Coast Guard Chief Information Officer’s (CIO) Office, Commandant (CG-4, CG-6, CG-7, and CG-93); and Coast Guard Cyber Command (CGCC). Tasks to achieve this goal include: 1) Providing expertise to revise the current Expense Allocation Model (EAM) to reflect changes in the organization. 2) Providing facilitation and support in the allocation of costs to Coast Guard assets and non-asset missions. 3) Providing expertise to develop reimbursable standard rates for Coast Guard assets. 4) Providing expertise to develop variable cost rates for Coast Guard assets. 5) Providing expertise and assistance to identify and modify costs drivers for Direct, Support, Overhead, Cost of Capital, Depreciation, and Pension Cost Pools. 6) Providing expertise to produce a current Master Data Set (MDS). This cube uses the unassigned and un-summarized data from the Total Cost Pool for additional data analysis. 7) Providing support for deployment and facilitation of Support Costs Surveys to the Coast Guard’s support units. 8) Providing expertise in reconciling the EAM output data to the Coast Guard’s Statement of Net Cost. 9) Providing support to identify gaps in internal controls for the EAM process and making corrections as necessary. 10) Providing support to revise the EAM methodology procedures and user guide. 11) Providing expertise to correct problem areas identified during the current update. 12) Providing expertise to address internal control weaknesses.

NAICS: 541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Contractor: Logistics Health Inc. and AMN Healthcare
Description:
This contract is to obtain contractor-managed licensed medical professionals for COVID-19 vaccine administration in support of federal assistance to state, local, tribal, and territorial (SLTT) partners in response to all Major Disaster Declarations for the COVID-19 Pandemic, in accordance with section 403 of the Robert T. Stafford Act, the public health emergency declared on January 31, 2020 pursuant to section 319 of the Public Health Service Act, 42 U.S.C. 247d, and the Public Readiness and Emergency Preparedness Act (PREP Act) Declaration issued on February 4, 2020 and all subsequent amendments. FEMA intends to award up to two (2) zoned Indefinite Delivery-Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contracts.  One IDIQ contract will be awarded per zone, as explained below.   Both single-award IDIQ contracts will include Time and Material (T&M) contract line-item numbers (CLINS) and FEMA anticipates issuing T&M task orders off the single-award IDIQ contracts. 
 
 The federal government will support SLTT vaccination programs by providing resources for pre-existing state or local facilities and/or establishing new federally operated facilities. Facilities will be established as fixed facility, drive-through facility, or as a mobile vaccination clinic. Site selection for vaccination sites will be needs based, data driven, and in support of SLTT requests. 
  
 The government estimates up to 700 (as an example, if two separate contracts are awarded, each contract shall support 350 personnel per contractor) licensed healthcare professionals to be deployed to various SLTT vaccination sites nationwide in support of COVID-19 vaccination efforts.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
1.3 Objectives: The objective of this task order is to enhance OPPA’s capability by providing augmentation support staff supporting the following areas of business process improvement, project management, analytical, technical, and communication.  
 
 1.4 Scope: The following categories of services are required for several OPPA initiatives.
  
 •	Business process and project management: Support processes for the development, management, and organization of policies, related documents, and associated artifacts. Develop policy management tools (including job aids and web-based tools) using Microsoft products such as SharePoint, OneNote, Teams, or OneDrive) to make information more accessible and transparent. Support data management processes including data collection, quality assurance, and analysis. 
 
 •	Analytic support: Provide support to OPPA programs, projects, and activities to analyze, interpret, and communicate various information and data. This activity includes support for various projects and actions (e.g., tasker management with OPPA Action Office) and support to working groups or governance bodies that requires coordination, aggregation, and reporting of information and data. 
 
 •	Technical support, including dashboard and website development, testing, and maintenance: Provide subject matter expert (SME) support to improve the effectiveness of OPPA initiatives and projects. Using Information and Communications Technologies (ICT) such as SharePoint, Power BI, and Tableau to develop, test, and maintain relevant dashboards, visualizations, and websites for OPPA.
 
 •	Meeting support: Facilitate or support various meetings. Arrange for meeting logistics to include scheduling and set up of meeting rooms (in person or virtual spaces), arrange for audio/video and accessible capabilities or tools as required. Prepare read ahead material, take meeting notes, and create Summary of Conclusions, minutes, or other written products as required and using provided templates.   This requires one cleared analyst at the TS/SCI level for classified meeting logistics and support.
 
 •	Communication support: Support internal and external messaging strategy and execution; correspondence development; stakeholder interactions; coordination of meetings, workshops, and trainings. 
 
 •	Governance Support: The contractor will provide overarching business process improvement, technical support, communication and training support, and general meeting support to the five strategically aligned governance bodies (Human Capital Governance Board, Equity Enterprise Steering Group, Climate Adaptation Steering Group, the Training, Education, and Professional Development Enterprise Steering Group, and the Readiness Enterprise Steering Group).

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Contract Vehicle: Program Management, Administrative, Operations (Clerical), and Technical Support Services (PACTS II)
Description:
The Office of Privacy Management (CG-6P) is responsible for policy and oversight for USCG’s Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) and Privacy Programs. The CG-6P FOIA Program ensures compliance with Federal laws and Federal and Departmental policies, including fulfilling reporting requirements to Congress, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Department of Justice (DOJ), the Office of Management and Budget (OMB), and the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) relating to FOIA. The CG-6P Privacy Program ensures compliance with the Privacy Act, the E-Government Act, and other Federal laws, and Federal and Departmental policies, including completion of privacy compliance documentation, issuance of USCG privacy policies, oversight of privacy incidents and privacy compliance reviews, and privacy training.
 
 The purpose of this task order is to obtain Contractor professional, technical, and management support services for United States Coast Guard (USCG), Office of Privacy Management (CG-6P) and Office of Investigation and Casualty Analysis (CG-INV). These support services include documentation, assessment, analysis, research, data processing, data entry, and office support for CG-6P FOIA and Privacy Programs.

The Government requires technical assistance in support of Public Assistance (PA) to develop a process by which additional codes can be vetted for inclusion in future CBCSS Policy updates.
 The overarching objectives are to: (1) review of codes and code authorities for appropriateness in the CBCSS Policy and (2) continue to develop the list of codes, specifications, and standards by developing tools that FEMA staff can use in vetting the appropriateness of the inclusion of different codes and standards.

NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
CRDI requires the assistance of a contractor to conduct a Barrier Analysis (BA) as prescribed by the EEOC’s MD-715 (also known as root-cause analysis). This requires the contractor to collect and review data, conduct statistical analysis, policy review, review of agency practices, conducting interviews and/or focus groups with key stakeholders, review of current and/or former climate assessments/reports, and any other methods deemed feasible and appropriate.  The purpose of the BA is to identify the root cause(s) of identified concerns, and provide recommendations to address identified barriers.   
  
 The agency’s focus for this BA is diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility. CRDI seeks to uncover any institutional, attitudinal or physical barriers at TSA that impact our organizational culture negatively or result in discouraging potential applicants from seeking employment at TSA. The 2018-2026 TSA Strategy (TSA Strategy) provides that “Commit to our People” is one of the agency’s three key strategic goals. In describing this goal, the TSA Strategy provides:
 
 TSA’s most important assets are the dedicated professionals securing our Nation’s transportation system. We will foster a diverse, inclusive, and transparent work environment, establishing TSA as a federal employer of choice. TSA will utilize available tools and authorities to cultivate a skilled workforce prepared and equipped to meet the challenges of tomorrow. We will transform our organizational culture to promote an entrepreneurial spirit and operational excellence.

 •	DHS Biometric Standards Working Group (BSWG)
 •	DHS’s Data Stewardship Tactical Working Group (DSTWG), 
 •	INCITS,
 •	ISO
 •	ISO/IEC JTC1
 •	NIEM, and
 •	NIST Information Technology Laboratory (ITL).

CTC’s trailer infrastructure efficiency has been reduced because of age of trailers and worn parts.  Due to the continuous use and increased demand of canine transport, additional repairs are needed frequently. The increased costs for maintenance and frequency of repair have further reduced our ability to provide a safe, secure, and dependable transport. For these reasons, the purchase of these trailers is essential in meeting the requirement for canine transport to and from the training environments. The existing trailer infrastructure does not provide the capability of the increased canine production.  The canine transport trailers must be capable of sustaining consistent climate controlled environments to promote a healthier environment for the canines before and after training.  Additionally, the trailer should have a dual door system to improve the safety of both the canine and instructor and trainers during the loading, unloading, and staging of the canines.

 The agency will be utilizing GSA MAS IT Schedule 70 for this requirement.

CISA has a requirement for building cloud-based data integrations requiring zero-code development which can be executed on a scheduled or ad-hoc basis. The integration platform must support native connectivity to a range of CISA data sources (e.g., popular commercial relational database management systems, Microsoft Azure Government Cloud, Microsoft Office 365, ServiceNow, Amazon Web Services). No CISA data should transit the integration platform and must remain within CISA enclaves. 
 
 What CISA is looking for: Data collection; data integration and interoperability; data integrity and analysis; data access and security; and information sharing and dissemination. The purpose of this solicitation is to purchase access to a cloud-hosted, Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) authorized capability that can connect to CISA data sources (on-prem and in various cloud providers) to schedule and monitor data integration activities.

Description:
U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) is seeking to establish a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) contract for brand name Dejero UGS Communications Equipment.  The specified equipment is the only equipment able to interconnect and function with the current CBP WAN architecture without extensive and costly re-design as well as a significant delay in implementing the ICP and modernizing the CBP WAN infrastructure to support the mission.  Dejero equipment was originally selected due to the compatibility to CBP’s existing Network Access Control (NAC) solution ISE and its compatibility and full integration to the existing network and security tools Digit Network Architecture (DNA) and Stealth watch.  All of  this equipment are Dejero proprietary products.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: NASA SEWP, no set aside

Description: Per ICE’s Performance Based National Detention Standards (PBNDS), ICE is required to provide a comprehensive law library for detainees within its custody. This requirement is to provide continuation and maintenance of the comprehensive legal law library for a base year and one 12-month option period. This service is required to ensure ICE detained noncitizens have access to a properly equipped electronic law library, inclusive of legal materials and equipment to facilitate the preparation of supporting documentation related to their immigration case. This requirement specifically provides 250 external hard drives to detention facilities located in 25 field offices, which lack adequate internet access and 45,000 online custom interface applications for use on ICE provided tablets .

The Office of Firearms and Tactical Program (OFTP) supports the mission of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) by providing world class firearms and tactical training, equipment, support, and guidance to promote officer safety and effective execution of the ICE law enforcement mission. 
 
 The Support Operations Unit in Washington, D.C.  is responsibility for firearms and tactics related information management, policy, and ammunition. This includes managing the systems used for ICE law enforcement asset accountability and training, researching and developing policy related to use of force, firearms, armor, and related areas to including use of force reporting, and the procurement and distribution of ammunition for ICE and partner agencies. 
 
 The Armory Operations Unit (AOU) located in Altoona, PA provides armory services to include inspection, repair building, maintenance, and disposal of all agency owned firearms and authorized Personally Owned Handguns. The unit also conducts technical testing and evaluation of firearms and law enforcement equipment to ensure that all produces issues to the field are the best available. 
 
 The Tactical Operations Division (TOD) is located in Ft. Benning, Georgia and includes the Homeland Security Investigations Tactical Operations Unit (HSI TOU) and the Enforcement and Removal Operations Tactical Operations Unit (ERO TOU). These units are responsible for developing and delivering post-basic, advanced, specialized, and use of force related training on-site at Fort Benning or in the field. The units also provide subject matter expertise in use of force related queries. The training provided by the TOD certifies instructors for firearms, defensive tactics, special response team leaders, and members, and field armorers. The TOD also develops practical courses for field office training. 
 
 The TOD’s immediate goals are as follows:
 
 •	Provide customized solutions to ICE law enforcement’s rapidly evolving mission and requirements 
 •	Develop and expand advanced training and instructor training in the TOD course catalog 
 •	Increase the TOD’s training and operational support to the agency’s expanding SRT program
 
 To meet these requirements the TOD requires training support services that due to the increased demand for training, cannot be provided by current staff.

CBP requires helium product and trailer support to ensure 24/7 365 continuous operations and maintenance of TARS eight operational sites. Currently, TARS has eight (8) trailers at multiple sites that are out of certification, with another twenty-two (22) trailers DLA-E is prepared to transfer ownership over to CBP that require recertification. Based on current and future requirements, TARS will require a minimum of fourteen (14) trailers to be certified by the 31 March 2023 deadline to avoid disruption of site operations.
 
 Acquisition Strategy: C type contract; sole source to a large business.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) continues to have a requirement to provide non-Information Technology Program Management and Administration (PM&A) support to its intrinsic and cross-organizational missions. DHS is re-competing its 100% Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) set-aside Strategic Sourcing Vehicle (SSV) Program Management, Administrative, Clerical and Technical Services (PACTS) II for a third generation.   The intent of this SSV is to provide a superior, consistent, and standardized solution to common PM&A requirements with a suite of basic services such as; consulting, clerical, personnel, physical distribution, billing, reporting, operations, financial planning, stenotype, and record keeping. This procurement is in the market research phase and the requirements may change over time.  This message will be updated accordingly.  DHS is considering the following NAICS codes for this SSV: 561110 Office Administrative Services; 541611 Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services; and 541330 Engineering Services

Description:
Contractor shall furnish all labor, material, equipment, transportation, disposal, supervision, and incidental related work necessary to perform maintenance dredging of the entrance channel from Huntington Bay to CG Station Eatons Necks mooring basin, channel typically silts in to the point where the water depth is a danger to small boat navigation after 18 months.  In years with increased tropical cyclone or winter storms, it only takes 14 months for the channel to become dangerously shallow.  The operational draft of the RB-M and the RB-Ms are 4 and 3 respectively.  If not dredged annually, Station Eatons Necks boats would not be able to safely transit to and from its docks by approximately August and boat ops and maintenance efforts would be severely impacted if not shut down completely.
 
 The work shall be performed at USCG Station Eatons Neck, Northport, NY.

Anticipated solicitation posting on GSA 541930 Schedule. FEMA requires over the phone telephonic interpretation services be available on a continuous basis (24/7/365) to support its disaster and other designated humanitarian/special campaigns.  Interpretative service providers need to be able to address the multitude of languages spoken within the United States during normal periods of activity and when call volume spikes during disaster situations and humanitarian/special campaign efforts. 
 
 In order to assist its disaster and humanitarian missions, FEMA agents in a number of dedicated response centers receive calls on a 1-800 number. The agent takes information from those calling FEMA, then translates the information. If a caller speaks a language that the FEMA agent is not capable of understanding, the agent shall have immediate access to an interpretation support service. The FEMA agent can then establish a three-way conference call including a representative from the support service able to interactively translate the conversation. One of the most specialized and high priority aspects of this requirement is the ability to handle calls made by the linguistically diverse residents and potential disaster survivors of the United States and its territories. NOTE: the Contractor shall interpret all spoken languages irrespective of whether or not FEMA has encountered the language in the past.

The United States (U.S.) Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Office of Intelligence (OI), Intelligence Enterprise Training Academy (IETA) provides comprehensive, integrated, performance-based training to enable the CBP Intelligence Enterprise workforce with the core and technical (tradecraft and subject matter expertise) competences necessary to execute the CBP Intelligence Enterprise mission.  
 
 The IETA has established training programs that must be executed for the CBP IE to become fully functioning and operational in support of the U.S. CBP mission requirements. IETA has an existing training portfolio of at least 13 courses. Most of these training programs are ready for delivery as they currently exist, while some will require updates and enhancements. At the same time, at least 15 training content gaps have been identified in a recent job task to training analysis. These content gaps will require the application rapid development processes to build appropriate training from design through implementation. Courses will use appropriate e-Learning and/or classroom-based forms of instruction for delivery.
 
 The Contractor shall provide a broad range of intelligence training program services (for example - instructors, surveillance personnel, instructional system specialists) that will support the entire intelligence cycle across all CBP IE mission areas (including border security, immigration, counterterrorism, counterintelligence, counter proliferation, cyber network security, trade security, critical infrastructure, and other homeland security issues).

Project Summary:  Existing roof has had several small repairs and roof warranties expired in 2017. This project will improve the resiliency and efficiency of TCY’s Buildings by replacing the existing roof system with Miami Dade County & Energy Star Compliant Roof system.
 Justification: The building envelope needs to be weather tight to provide a safe environment for training. Slips, trips and falls can occur on wet floor surfaces due to roof leakage. Leaks also contribute to the deterioration of the existing roof and building structure.
 Risk/Potential Impact To Personnel or Assets if Not Funded: Impact will be continued deterioration of the roof and structure contributing to mold and increased
 water accumulation to the training facility. Additional maintenance will be required during/after rain events to prevent deterioration of interior finishes and training equipment.

Contractor support is needed for ongoing customized human capital consulting services based on work completed by DHS and performed by a prior contractor. Specific required services will include: assessment strategy refinement, assessment suite preparation, assessment instrument implementation, proctored assessment support, structured interview support, assessment program monitoring and evaluation, and subscription services for a software tool to maintain and secure customized assessment instruments, upload promotional videos about working for the DHS Cybersecurity Service, notify applicants automatically of the interview via email and/or text, and administer and score asynchronous and synchronous structured interviews. 
 
 The objective of this contract is to assist DHS in the ongoing development, operation and evaluation of a new competency-focused cybersecurity workforce assessment program, which would enable:
 •	Applicant screening and assessment to support selection decisions; and 
 •	Employee proficiency testing to support pay setting and adjustments and verify the accomplishment of skill attainment/enhancement.

NAICS: 237990 - Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Description:
Contractor shall furnish all labor, material, equipment, transportation, disposal, supervision, and incidental related work necessary to patch holes in approximately 80 tie rod drill holes along the east and west side main pier sheet pile bulkhead (along approx.650 LF). Along east side main pier, install a patch over the hole and pressure grout behind the patch (35 patches). Along the west side main pier, excavate concrete pavement behind the bulkhead, repair sinkholes under the concrete pavement, patch tie rod hole from the inside, and install new concrete pavement (approx. 400 CY). Replace two broken tie-rods on the east side of the main pier and install 3 tie rods where identified to be missing on the west side main pier.
 
 The work shall be performed at USCG Sector Northern New England, South Portland, ME.

 Location of work is USCG Sector New York, Staten Island, NY.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), Office of Response and Recovery (ORR), Field Operations
 Directorate (FOD), Workforce Development Division (WDD) requires professional instructional systems design (ISD) training services to support the
 assessment, planning, development, delivery, maintenance, and evaluation of FEMA training courses and materials. Required contractor support includes: 
 ISD services to include the assessment/evaluation, development of classroom, webinar and online training courses, materials, curriculum and
 experiential/practical activities, and course piloting efforts; and â Project management support for Curriculum Development Program to include project
 management plan and project schedule, quality control plan, communications plan, risk management plan, change management plan. The goal is to develop
 specialized and cross-cadre training opportunities for a diverse group of personnel who perform incident workforce functions during all-hazard FEMA
 operations. These courses will include suites of multi-level training for Incident Workforce positions that also have the ability to integrate with field and
 mission-focused training activities to support the development of an expeditionary incident workforce. The training courses and related activities will be
 delivered by FEMA federal employees at FEMA facilities in a classroom setting as instructor-led activities as well as in virtual settings. FEMAs current
 procurement strategy is to establish a multiple-award Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) with an 8(a) set-aside. Under the IDIQ, FEMA anticipates that
 any resulting task orders may be awarded on a Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP) basis. The applicable NAICS code is 611430 Professional and Management
 Development Training. The applicable PSC is U008 Education/Training and Training/Curriculum Development.

In FY23, CBP intends to award Basic Ordering Agreements (BOA) and Task Orders to socially and economically disadvantaged 8(a) and Alaska and Native American companies that we do business with on existing agreements. The Alaska and Native American BOAs have ceilings of $25M; the 8(a) BOAs have ceilings of $4.5M. CBP intends to use these BOA task orders for construction and services, i.e., repairs, alterations, related to facility and non-facility requirements. The purpose of the BOA task orders are to facilitate awards for these requirements to more quickly and efficiently get contractors working and to avoid some administrative efforts associated with them, thus saving time prior to task order awards. Each awarded task order will include a Statement of Work which falls within the BOA scope. Acquisition Strategy: The BOA task orders will cover construction projects and facility repairs for the BPAM Program Office supporting the 20 CBP Sectors. 
 
 Acquisition Strategy: The orders will be awarded directly to 8(a) and ANC firms.

USCIS is procuring administrative & program support to our offices located in Washington, DC; Irving and Dallas, TX; Williston, VT and Camp Springs, MD. Human Capital and Training (HCT) mission requires contractor support to assist program managers and other federal staff in efficiently managing and coordinating training programs, as well as performing the business functions required in support of all HCT Divisions. HCT manages several divisions that include Human Capital & Training Business Center (HCTB); Training & Career Development Division (TCDD) including the Academy Training Center where numbers instructor lead courses are run; Human Capital Policy & Program (HCPP); Human Resource Operations Center (HROC) and Labor and Employee Relations (LER).  These divisions encompass a full range of programs that include training and educational opportunity for employees, personnel, management, performance management, strategy and policy, worker's compensation, and employee resources.  USCIS plans to award this requirement as a 8(a) direct award and a vendor has been identified.

The contractor shall provide all management, tools, equipment and labor necessary to ensure that janitorial services are performed at DHS/FEMA Louisiana Integration & Recovery Office in a manner that will maintain a satisfactory facility condition and present a clean, neat and professional appearance, consistent with industry quality standards for this type of service.  This is a 173,000 square foot building with a current average staff of 850 personnel.  Only 148,258 square feet is required to be cleaned.  Services to be provided during operating hours without disrupting staff work.  While providing these services, the contractor will also keep staff safe from cleaning processes and chemicals by posting appropriate signage and installing physical barriers to unsafe processes or areas. NAICS: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Description:
The Scope of this effort includes evaluation of FEMA’s exercise programs, doctrine, and customer satisfaction of exercise delivery, to include both internal and external customers. To effectively evaluate customer satisfaction within the Agency’s exercise delivery travel will be required to FEMA Regional office, Joint Field Offices, and state partners who have participated in the National Exercise Program in the last 2 years. 
 
 The contractor will examine a quantitative and qualitive analysis of identified gaps in exercise performance with the aim to identify root causes.  
 
 - As a first priority, the contractor will assess whether FEMA is organized and resourced to support its current exercise requirements.  
 
 - Second, the contractor will evaluate FEMA exercise data collection and after-action reporting in terms of their impact on a) development of future exercises, b) FEMA workforce readiness, and preparedness, overall. 
 
 - Third, the contractor will assess industry best practices based on a review of government and non-government entities in order to identify areas where FEMA exercise doctrine and approaches might be qualitatively improved.

U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) 418' Maritime Security Cutter-Large (WMSL) multi-year, multi-vessel drydock maintenance and repairs for USCG Cutters (USCGCs) homeported in Honolulu, HI, primarily USCGCs KIMBALL and MIDGETT, in Fiscal Years (FYs) 2023 through 2026. Drydock maintenance and repairs include: vessel dry-docking, tank inspection and preservation, interior and exterior ship structure preservation, propulsion shafting strain gauge alignment, propulsion shafting inspections, propulsion shaft seal maintenance, propeller cleaning and inspection, controllable pitch propeller hub assembly maintenance, fathometer transducer maintenance, doppler speed log maintenance, sea strainer overhauls, sea valve overhauls, rudder maintenance, rudder seal maintenance, anchor and anchor chain maintenance and preservation, stern boat ramp maintenance and preservation, transom doors inspection and maintenance, sideport door inspection and maintenance, cathodic protection system maintenance, sea trial performance support, and similar work. The USCG anticipates restricting competition to capable facilities within a 50 mile commuting radius of the Honolulu, HI homeport on the basis of military considerations and agency requirements.

The United States Department of Homeland Security (DHS), U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is responsible for the detention, health, welfare, transportation and deportation of alien detainees in removal proceedings, and those subject to final order of removal from the United States. The mission of the Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) is the planning, management and direction of broad programs relating to the supervision, detention, and deportation of detainees who are in the United States illegally. These activities are chiefly concerned with the processing and enforcement of departure from the United States of detainees who have entered illegally or have become removable after admission. In implementing its mission, ERO ICE Air Operations Division (IAO) is responsible for carrying out orders for the required departure of detainees handed down in removal proceedings, or prior thereto, and arranging for detention of detainees when such detention becomes necessary. ERO responsibilities include providing reliable, safe, and secure mass air transportation of alien nationals placed in federal custody. Daily Scheduled Large Aircraft (DSLA) - aircraft must be based in Alexandria, Louisiana (AEX), Harlingen, Texas (HRL), San Antonio, Texas (SAT), Miami, Florida (MIA), or Mesa, Arizona (IWA) with daily scheduled flights to include, but not limited to: North America, Central America, South America, the Caribbean, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Haiti, Nicaragua, Brazil, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Jamaica, or other domestic destinations throughout the United States.

The ICE Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) Personnel Security Division (PSD) has the responsibility to provide service-wide policy and procedures designed to ensure that people

Adjudications of suitability, fitness, and eligibility are done by a Federal staff of about 174 Personnel Security Specialists (PSS).

NAICS: 237990 - Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Description: Numerous vulnerabilities exist regarding force protection for Air Station Sacramento.  Currently, vehicles entering the facility are only screened through a two way audio communications before a vehicle is permitted on base.  Once inside the perimeter, the watch stander must exit the small gate shack, cross the street, and validate the individuals credentials, removing the individual from the "Panic Switch".  Once the chain link fence gate has been opened, there is no way to further restrict access to the base from a non-compliant vehicle.  The design of the front gate also lacks any "best practices" when it comes to entry points for facilities.  Video and audio feeds from the key pad to the gate shack, active traffic barriers, secondary traffic spikes, non-linear approaches, and separate pedestrian access gate.  Additionally, the north boundary is protected exclusively by a single chain link fence.  There is no buffer area between the fence and the neighbor, and privacy scat may make the problem worse.  Cipher locks should be installed on the south apron gate leading to hangars 1032 and 1033.  Currently, anyone with airfield access could drive through the apron gate.

TSA requires a COTS Occupational Safety and Health Information System (OSHIS), customized to meet TSA’s specific requirements, to serve as the centralized repository for all safety, health, and workers’ compensation information. 
 
 This will allow TSA to comply with laws, regulations, policies, and procedures governing Federal Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) and Federal workers’ compensation programs. Safety and health related data entered by users into the OSHIS from TSA forms, including injuries, illnesses, unsafe/unhealthful working conditions, facility inspections and job hazard information, trigger system workflows that include event-driven electronic notifications to each respective entity when predefined actions occur. Workflows ensure that incident and inspection items entered into OSHIS are routed and approved per TSA policy, proper reporting of workplace hazards and injuries transpire, and mitigation of identified hazards are recorded. These notifications expedite any necessary actions from each receiving entity. 
 
 At a high level the OSHIS shall: 
 - Launch unique form-dependent workflows when data is entered into the SIS, and send out notifications to individuals based on system role or profile and office locations as workflows progress. 
 - Be accessible by at least 600 facilities world-wide; available to the SIS user community 24 hours per day, seven days per week, with 98% up-time. 
 - Support over 20,000 reports of unsafe or unhealthful working conditions, injuries, illnesses, and damage to property, facilities, equipment, or motor vehicles on a yearly basis, including annual formal safety inspection reports. 
 - Meet all security-related requirements as required by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and TSA. 
 - Interface with, and exchange data with other systems, both internal to TSA/FAMS as well as external to the organization. 
 - Possess the ability to support other Federal agencies in its Safety mission. 
 - Migrate approximately 20 years worth of prior data from an on-prem hosting solution to the TSA Cloud.
 
 Existing COTS system is in place, this follow-on procurement is primarily for Operations and Maintenance (O&M).
